meaning_mnemonic:
オノマトペ comes from the French word “onomatopée” which, as you can probably guess, means <vocabulary>onomatopoeia</vocabulary>.

オノマトペ has a wider meaning than its English equivalent, and it also covers <vocabulary>mimetic word</vocabulary>s, which are words that evoke ideas and actions rather than sounds.

トランプ comes from the English word "trump", as in "a trump card", but it means <vocabulary>deck of cards</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>playing cards</vocabulary> in Japanese.

The Japanese meaning probably comes from card games played by English-speaking Westerners back in the day. Japanese people heard the word "trump" a lot, and assumed it meant a deck of cards.
